reviews.review:
OLAF'S BACK, & so are his human friends.

Frozen 2.

At 1 hour & 43 minuets, this sequel to the surprise hit film is a pretty decent follow up. It feels not only like a continuation, but an escalation of the story.

The cast hasn't lost a step. Elsa, Anna, Christoph, Sven, & Olaf are all as entertaining & endearing as ever, their respective actors really breathing life into everyone. The rest of the cast gave noteworthy performances as well.

The animation wasn't 3D, but it sure felt like it. Everything had a weight & a detail that made me think there were practical models mixed in with the animation. The water & ice animations were especially impressive.

The music was a mix of old & new, honesty & tongue-in-cheek. I doubt any of the songs'll have the same cultural impact as 'Let It Go' or 'Snow Man', but they were enjoyable.

Frozen 2, to me, felt like a film about growing up, facing obstacles, & coming to terms with a past that may be less rosy than you remember. The action, comedy, suspense, & heart of this film outshine any minor flaw. It definitely stands proudly alongside the first film. 4 outta 5 stars. Winter has come, & it is awesome.
I Love It. Into The Unknown is way more popular then Let It Go.

The adventure aspect of the movie was good as well was the visuals.  The storyline of the movie was more intense than the first. Definitely more emotional. Songs were good but not as catchy as the first movie. If you watch carefully, the movie has big political and social undertones.
We really enjoyed it. Great movie!!
definitely more mature than the first movie, but in a way that's understandable for little kids. we all enjoyed it.

I felt like the story line wasn’t linear and had a lot of interjections, but the interjections were mostly Olaf and he was well worth watching!! Very heartfelt, humorous, and well done. You’ll walk away having enjoyed a great movie!
it was magical my two seven year olds loved it
breathtaking!!   I am a 38 year old women and was in awe most of the movie. My 2 girls loved it!    wish could see again and again and again.
